title: Todd Iodice, CFA
text: Quantitative finance professional and data scientist with over five years of experience at T. Rowe Price, where I’ve led portfolio implementation for ETFs and multi-asset strategies, built internal tools and AI agents, and spearheaded quantitative research initiatives. I hold a CFA charter, a BS in Economics and BA in Mathematics from Duke University (Magna Cum Laude), and an MS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University with a focus on Data Science and Cloud Computing.

title: Todd Iodice, CFA
text:
Experience

T. Rowe Price — Baltimore, MD
Lead Portfolio Investment Analyst, Associate Vice President | June 2021 – Present

Overhauled the firm’s approach to customized accounts and benchmarks by developing the Model Maker tool, enabling the firm to open dozens of new accounts with complex requirements from portfolio managers and clients in a scalable manner without increasing headcount or operational risk.
Led portfolio implementation and managed operations for the firm’s ETFs and multi-asset strategies, including investment proposals to improve capital efficiency, tracking error minimization, cashflow investment, cash management, and trade modeling across all asset classes — especially derivatives.
Created AI agents using Amazon Kiro to expedite software development and perform business functions using customized tooling, for purposes such as cash monitoring and basket generation.
Headed the Global Trading Innovations team, enabling members of the Global Trading division with quantitative and technical skills to collaborate, share best practices, and develop high-quality tools.
Ran (and won) a division-wide hackathon that spurred 7 impactful ideas to fruition.
Coded tools to automate workflows and improve accuracy, resulting in a significant reduction in error incidents and enabling the introduction of 3 new multi-asset strategies.
Directed requirements, prioritization, and testing for Technology teams to transition off legacy systems, build data services, and provide infrastructure for business-developed APIs.
Managed 2 interns, mentored 2 junior associates, and trained dozens of team members on coding, data, and best practices.

Investment Fellow | June 2019 – May 2021

Rotated through 4 of the firm’s quantitative research teams across Equity, Fixed Income, and Multi-Asset.
Researched macroeconomic factors and developed global regime models, improving Multi-Asset Steering Committee decisions on asset allocation for Target Date Funds.
Developed quantitative investment signals using alternative data sources — including employment reviews and credit card transactions — to identify opportunities for the firm’s quantitative equity strategies.
Created data tools and performed ad-hoc analyses to support the fundamental equity research platform.
